author: USA TODAY, Jayme Fraser, Jessica Bliss, Giacomo Bologna, and Daveen Rae Kurutz, USA TODAY NETWORK
title: Hope, exhaustion, fear: Health workers in quiet areas prep for COVID-19 chaos while colleagues in other cities rush in
description: Health care workers from around the country share stories of how they preparing, or already dealing with, the crush of COVID-19 patients.
content:
One day last week in New York City, ambulances queued up outside the entrance to the emergency room. Passengers waited, some for five hours, to be triaged. They sat in the lobby hours more before seeing a doctor.
Dr. Calvin Sun a freelance ER physician who s… [+20005 chars]
